title: Wheel Spoke Tensioning

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Do not replace more than two spokes on each wheel. If a wheel requires more than two spokes replacing, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Do not tighten three or more wheel spoke nipples. If three or more wheel spoke nipples require tightening, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Incorrectly built wheels will affect traction, stability and control of the motorcycle.
Operation with damaged or defective wheels is dangerous
leading to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Note that some parts are not shown in the illustrations to provide more clarity.
All wheel spoke nipples must be at the required torque.
The wheel axial and radial run-outs must be within the run-out tolerances.
If the torque figures and/or the run-out tolerances can not be achieved, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Incorrectly built wheels will adversely affect traction, stability and handling which may lead to loss of control and an accident.
Operation with damaged or defective wheels is dangerous and loss of motorcycle control or an accident could result.
Starting at the tyre valve, check that the torque of each wheel spoke nipple is a minimum of
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
If one or two front wheel spoke nipples are less than
tighten the wheel spoke nipple to a minimum of
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle.
If one or two wheel spoke nipples are less than
tighten the wheel spoke nipple to a minimum of
If three or more front or rear wheel spoke nipples are less than
, the wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder.
Wheel hub (brake disc removed for clarity)
